weather_report:
Evanston is experiencing crisp and cool conditions this evening, with the temperature in the low 20s and mostly clear skies. The air carries a briskness as a fierce wind sweeps from the west-northwest at nearly 30 miles per hour, causing wind chills to dip as low as -2. Tonight, expect the chill to deepen, with temperatures falling to the low teens as nighttime settles in. Tomorrow promises mostly sunny skies with temperatures reaching the upper 20s, though it’s anticipated that the cold will linger in the afternoon.

The beach, under the moonlight, has an expansive, tranquil beauty, unmarred by precipitation. The scene is certainly more pleasant than unpleasant, though anyone venturing outside will require warm clothing to fend off the biting cold. Waves on Lake Michigan will likely reflect the brisk winds—a reminder of winter's approach. This time of year typically sees temperatures in the seasonally low range, so the current chill aligns with expectations for late November.

For those looking to embrace the season, bundled outdoor activities like brisk walks along the shoreline or simply enjoying the scenery may suit the day. Remember to dress warmly—layers, insulated jackets, and hats are highly recommended. Though today isn't a holiday, the festive spirit of the season is palpable, with the joy of celebrations on the horizon.
